question: She ain't gonna die, huh?
answer: She's gonna live. She didn't steal nothin', She didn't touch his poke.

question: No?
answer: All she done was... when she seen he had a teensy little pecker... she gave a giggle. That's all. She didn't know no better. You gonna hang 'em, Little Bill?

question: Clyde, step across to the German's an' fetch up one of his bullwhips.
answer: A whippin'? That's all they get? After what they done?

question: Whippin' ain't a little thing, Alice.
answer: But what they done, they...

question: Shut up, Alice. Little Bill, a whippin' ain't gonna settle this.
answer: No?

question: This here's a lawful contract... betwixt me an' Delilah Fitzgerald, the cut-whore. Now I brung her clear from Boston, paid her expenses an' all, an' I got a contract which represents an investment of capital.
answer: Property.

question: Damaged property. Like if I was to hamstring one of their cow ponies.
answer: You figure nobody'll want to fuck her.

question: Hell no. Leastways, they won't pay to do it.
answer: You boys are off of the Spade Outfit. Got your own string of ponies?

question: You?
answer: Six.

question: Guess you boys just as soon not have no trial an' fuss, huh?
answer: Five!

question: Don't matter, we don't need no whips. Spring comes an' Skinny don't have them ponies, I'm gonna...
answer: You... you ain't even gonna... whip 'em?

question: I fined 'em instead.
answer: For what they done? Skinny gets some ponies an' that's... ?

question: Ain't you seen enough blood for one night? Hell, Alice, they ain't loafers nor tramps nor bad men. They're hard workin' boys that was foolish. Why if they was given over to wickedness in a regular way...
answer: Like whores?

question: Huh?
answer: I seen how you got only three fingers on your left hand, though, so I guess you're calling yourself Mister Bill Munny.

question: William Munny, yeah.
answer: Same one as shot Charlie Pepper in Lake County?

question: You shot Charlie Pepper, didn't you? And you're the one killed William Harbey an' robbed the train over...
answer: Hold on, mister. Son, this here pig gotta be moved outta this pen, away from them others. Penny, you give yer brother a hand... Let's talk inside, mister. You're Pete Sothow's nephew, huh? Hell, I thought maybe you was someone come to kill me... ...for somethin' I done in the old days.

question: I could of... easy.
answer: Yeah, I guess so.

question: Like I was sayin' you don't look like no meaner than hell cold- blooded damn killer.
answer: Maybe I ain't.

question: Well, Uncle Pete said you was the goddamndest meanest sonofabitch ever lived an' if I ever wanted a partner for a killin', you was the worst one. Meanin' the best. On account of you're cold as snow an' don't have no weak nerve nor fear.
answer: He said that, huh?

question: I'm a damn killer myself, only I ain't killed so many as you because of my youth. Schofield Kid, they call me.
answer: Schofield? You from Schofield?

question: On account of my Schofield model Smith and Wesson pistol.
answer: Oh.

question: Well, how about it?
answer: About what?

question: Bein' my partner. I'm headin' North up around the Niobrara in Nebraska. Gonna kill a couple of no good cowboys.
answer: What for?

question: For cuttin' up a lady. They cut up her face an' cut her eyes out, cut her ears off an' her tits too.
answer: Jesus!

question: No cussin' now, Will. Go on out the pump an' clean up some an' I'll be along. Check them other pens. I ain't like that no more, Kid. Whiskey done it as much as anythin' I guess. I ain't touched a drop in ten years. My wife, she cured me of it... cured me of drink an' wickedness.
answer: Well... you don't look so prosper- ous. Hell, you could buy her a new dress out of your half. We could kill them two an' you could buy your wife one of them fancy...

question: She's passed on, Kid.
answer: Huh?

question: Been gone near three years now.
answer: Oh. Don't tell nobody about the reward an' all. Don't need no other gunmen tryin' to collect.

question: I don't never see nobody anyhow.
answer: If you was to change your mind, might be you could catch me... due West to the Western Trail an' North to Ogallala.

question: Where'd you get the money, huh?
answer: We ain't got it. We ain't got no money.

question: You told them cowboys you had it.
answer: We was... lyin'.

question: What you gonna do when somebody comes to collect? FUCK 'EM? FUCK 'EM A THOUSAND TIMES? The kind of people who'll come after that thousand, they won't tolerate if you don't have it. They won't just cut your face up a little. STUPID CUNTS!
answer: Oh, shit, shit an' damn, oh fuck my mother and my father, o damn an' jesus.

question: Hit your finger, huh?
answer: Huh? Hullo, Skinny. Snuck up on me. How do you like her?

question: Heard you done the roof yourself.
answer: Roof? Jesus, Skinny, I done practically every damn thing myself. Roberts boy hauled wood, that's all.

question: What's all that wood?
answer: Porch. I'm puttin' a porch on her so's I can puff my pipe of an evening an' drink my coffee an' watch the sun set. You come clear up here just to get a look at her?

question: Them whores...
answer: Yeah?

question: Them whores, they been fuckin' an' fuckin' all them cowboys that come into town the last two weeks...
answer: Shit, Skinny, we got railroad barons an' cattle barons, but you' re gonna be the first of the billiard barons.

question: ...They been fuckin' 'em, 'an tellin' every bow-legged one of 'em how they're payin' a thousand dollars to whatever sonofabitch kills them two boys which cut up Delilah.
answer: An' all them cowboys been riding that beef down to Kansas an' Cheyenne?

question: Yup.
answer: All week?

question: I didn't hear nothin' till last night.
answer: Word must have got all the way to Texas by now.

question: Oh, shit, Bill, I guess nobody's gonna come clear from Texas.
answer: They really got all that money, them whores?

question: You know how women kin lie... I knock 'em around a little, ask 'em where the money is, they say they don't have none?...but they coulda squirreled away that much, the five of 'em. Maybe.
answer: That much, huh?

question: You could run off them two cowboys.
answer: I could run off them whores.

question: Well, I guess they'll just up an' run anyhow, them two.
answer: Nope. They'll stay out on the Spade country where they got friends.

question: Hullo Sally... I... uh, I ain't seen you in near as long as this, uh... as this horse ain't felt the saddle.
answer: Come on in outta the sun, Bill. Sally, you see to Bill's horse. We ain't bad men no more, Bill. Hell, we're farmers.

question: Should be easy killin' em... supposin' they don't run off to Texas first.
answer: How long since you shot a gun at a man? Nine... ten years?

question: Eleven.
answer: Easy, huh? Hell, I don't know that it was all that easy then... an' we was young an' full of beans. Bill... if you was mad at 'em... if they done you wrong... I could see shootin' 'em...

question: We done stuff before for money, Ned.
answer: Well, we thought we was doin' it for money... What'd they do anyhow? Cheat at cards, steal some strays, spit on a rich fella?

question: Cut up a woman. Cut her eyes out, cut her tits off, cut her fingers off... done everythin' but cut up her cunny, I guess.
answer: Well, I guess they got it comin'... But you wouldn't go if Claudia was alive.

question: I guess you wouldn't mind to look in on my youngsters next week. Might be you could help them move a couple of them pigs if they got to separate 'em more.
answer: How long you gonna be, Bill?

question: Two weeks, I guess.
answer: This Kid, what's he like? Three ways?

question: Yup. You still got the Spencer rifle?
answer: Yeah, an' I could still hit a bird in the eye flyin'. Jesus, Bill.

question: He musta been movin' right along.
answer: We'll come across him tomorra, I guess. Got used to my bed. Ain't gonna feel to home out here.

question: Well, it ain't just the bed I'm gonna miss. I'm... Hell, Billy, I'm sorry. I didn't mean...
answer: It ain't nothin', don't fret it. She don't like it much, you goin' off with me.

question: Sally?
answer: She gave me the evil eye.

question: It's just... she's a Indian an' Indians ain't... overfriendly.
answer: I ain't blamin' her, Ned, I ain't holdin' it against her. She knew me back then... an' she seen what a no good sonofabitch I was... an' she won't allow how I've changed. She just don't know how I ain't like that no more.

question: Well, she...
answer: I ain't the same, Ned. Claudia, she... straightened me up, got me clear of the whiskey an' all. Us goin' to do this killin'... that don't mean I'm back to like I was. I just need the money... for a new start... for them youngsters. Remember that drover, the one I shot in the mouth so's the teeth come out the back of his head? I dream about him now an' again. I didn't have no reason to shoot him... not one I could remember when I sobered up.

question: You was a... a crazy sonofabitch.
answer: Nobody liked me... none of the boys. They was scared of me... figured I might shoot 'em out of pure meanness.

question: You ain't like that no more.
answer: Eagle... he hated my guts. Bonaparte didn't like me none.

question: Nor Quincy, I guess.
answer: Quincy, he was always watchin' me. Scared.

question: You ain't like that no more.
answer: Hell, no. I'm just a fella now. ain't no different from anyone else no more.

question: Hell, Bill, I always liked you... even back then.
answer: No you didn't. You wasn't no different, Ned.

question: Little Bill? Him scared?
answer: We never seen him up against any... like these ones... killers.

question: Little Bill come out of Kansas an' Texas, boys. He worked them tough towns.
answer: Just wondered. Anybody could be scared.

question: ...can see that there's a dignity in royalty... a majesty... that precludes the likelihood of assassination. A wise policy. But if you did, I can assure you, the sight of royalty would cause you to dismiss all thoughts of bloodshed and stand... in awe. Whereas, a president... I mean, why not shoot a president? Now this Strawberry Alice person, tell me again. Billiards, eh? Even though I don't really wish to play? Ah, I see. Come on, WW. Let's...
answer: Hullo, Bob. Boys, this here is English Bob.

question: Shit and fried eggs.
answer: Been a long time, Bob. You run out of Chinamen?

question: Little Bill, I thought you were dead. I see you shaved off your chin whiskers.
answer: Well, I was always tasting the soup two hours after I et it.

question: Say, Bill... You ever... ever go into town... an' all?
answer: Sure, I got to. Got to get supplies.

question: No. I mean... ...an' get yourself a woman? You know?
answer: Naw. Naw, I don't ever go into town for that. A man like me... A man like me can't get no woman but one he's gonna pay for... an' that ain't right... buyin' flesh. Claudia, God rest her soul, she wouldn't have wanted me doin' nothin' like that, me bein' a father, an' all.

question: Whaddaya do, just use your hand?
answer: Sometimes... yeah. I don't miss it all that much.

question: Yeah.
answer: Some fucker's shootin' at us.

question: Yeah.
answer: He hit you?

question: Naw. I bumped my head fallin' off of my horse.
answer: He ain't shootin' our way no more. He's shootin' over that way. Who's he shootin' at over that way?

question: Beats the hell out of me.
answer: You suppose maybe we're in somebody's field?

question: I didn't see nothin' planted.
answer: Fuck, he's shootin' at us again. Jesus, he's shootin' up the whole fucking horizon. You're marking us, Bill.

question: HEY, KID.
answer: Kid? The Kid's shootin at us?

question: IS THAT YOU, KID?
answer: Why would the Kid shoot at us?

question: Better'n you anyhow, Kid. You wasn't comin' close.
answer: Keep your damn hands offa that rifle, Mister.

question: I was only checkin' it for you. Thought maybe somethin' was bent.
answer: Nothin's bent.

question: Well, you was shootin' every which way an'...
answer: You gonna share your half with him?

question: You gonna share your half with him?
answer: Three ways, I figured.

question: No.
answer: Sorry, Ned. Guess I wasted your time. See ya, Kid!

question: You're goin' back with him?
answer: He's my partner. He don't go, I don't.

question: Oh shit.
answer: What the hell are you pissin' about, I'd like to know?

question: Huh?
answer: Well, what were you lookin' at anyhow?

question: Clouds, Kid. We was lookin' at them clouds on account of we got a storm ridin' up our ass.
answer: Oh, them. Hell, I seen them.

question: You was right to change your mind, Kid.
answer: Yeah?

question: I'm a damn good shot. See that hawk up there? I could kill that hawk with one shot.
answer: Hell, I could hit it too if I didn't mind wasting a shot.

question: There ain't no hawk up there, Kid. Can't see worth a shit, can you?
answer: See them fucking turtles?

question: How far kin you see?
answer: Far enough.

question: We ain't goin' to Nebraska on no turtle hunt. A hundred yards?
answer: More.

question: See that scrub oak yonder?
answer: Fuck you.

question: He's blind, for Chri...
answer: I ain't blind, you asshole.

question: Them boys look like real hard cases. Did you kill all seven of 'em dead, Bob... or did you just wing some of 'em? That is you there, ain't it, Bob? The Duck of Death?
answer: Uh... Duke.

question: Oh yeah... Duke. Well, Bob, you always was hell an' Jesus with a pistol... but seven of 'em, an' you protectin' the lady too... How'd you do it?
answer: Uh... It's... uh... generally considered desirable in the publishing business to... ah... take certain license in depicting the cover scene... for... ah... purposes involving the... ah, market place.

question: Well, Mister Beauchamp... from what I read of this here book, I'd have to say the writin' ain't a whole lot different from the pitcher.
answer: Uh... I can assure you, Mister Daggett... the events described within are based... on the accounts of eye witnesses and...

question: Meaning the duck himself, I guess.
answer: Duke.

question: Duck, I says. "You have insulted the honor of this beautiful woman, Corcoran," said the duck. "You must apologize." But Two Gun Corcoran would have none of it and, cursing, he reached for his pistols and would have killed them but The Duck was faster and hot lead blazed from his smoking sixguns."
answer: I believe that to be an accurate description of the events, sir... albeit there is a certain poetry to the language which...

question: Well, Mister Beauchamp, I was at the Blue Bottle Saloon in Wichita the night English Bob killed Corky Corcoran... an' I didn't see you there... nor no woman, nor no two-gun shooters nor nothin' like that.
answer: You were there?

question: First off... Corky didn't carry two pistols, though he should of.
answer: But he was called...

question: Some folks did call Old Corky "Two Gun" but not because he was sportin' two pistols but because he had a dick so big it was longer than the barrel on that Walker Colt he carried. An' the only insultin' he done was stickin' that big dick of his in some French Lady that Old Bob was sweet on... Well, one day Corky walked into the Blue Bottle and before he knows what's happening Bob takes a shot at him... and misses on account of he's drunker than hell. Well, that bullet whizzin' by panicked Corky, an' he done the wrong thing! Pulled his gun in such a damn hurry he shot off his own toe. Meantime, Bob aims good and squeezes off another... but he's so drunk he misses again an' hits the thousand dollar mirror behind the bar. Well, now the Duck of Death is good as dead 'cause this time Corky does right an' aims real good, no hurry...
answer: And?

question: Bam! That Walker Colt blew up in his hand... which was a failing common to that model. Now if Corky would have really had two guns instead of just a big dick he could have defended himself to the end.
answer: You... you mean... English Bob killed him while...?

question: Well, I guess you're gonna miss your fuckin' roof soon enough.
answer: Say, Bill. That business in Jackson County... did that really happen? I mean how they say it happened?

question: What business?
answer: An' how there was two deputies up close pointin' rifles at you... had you dead to rights... an' how you pulled out a pistol an' blew them both away to hell... an' only took a scratch yourself. Uncle Pete told me he never seen nothin' like it, shootin' your way out of a scrape like that.

question: Well... I don't recollect.
answer: You don't recollect! Say, Ned... ?

question: You don't recollect! Say, Ned... ?
answer: Yeah.

question: How many men you killed? Ain't you gonna answer?
answer: I don't like the question.

question: Well, I gotta know what kind of fellas I'm ridin' with, don't I? In case of a scrape.
answer: How many you killed, Kid?

question: Actually, then, Mister Corcoran was faster on the draw than the D... English Bob?
answer: Faster? Fast was his mistake. If he hadn't of been in such a goddamn hurry he would not have shot off his toe with his first shot and he would have killed old Bob. See, son, bein' a good shot an' bein' quick with a pistol... that don't do no harm... but it ain't much next to bein' cool.

question: But if the other fellow is quicker and fires first...
answer: He will be hurryin' and he will miss. That there is as fast as I can pull an' aim an' hit anythin' more'n ten feet away... unless it's a barn.

question: But... if he doesn't miss?
answer: Then he will kill you. That is why there are so few dangerous men like old Bob there... an' like me. It ain't so easy to shoot a man anyhow... an' if the sonofabitch is shootin' back at you... well, it'll unnerve most fellas. Look here, let me show you somethin'. See this here pistol? Take it. Go on, take a hold. Them's the keys. All you gotta do is shoot me an' you an' English Bob can ride out free as birds.

question: Is... is it... loaded?
answer: Wouldn't be no good if it wasn't. You got to cock it though. An' you got to point it. Go on, point it. All you gotta do is pull on the trigger, mister. Hot, ain't it? You never even put your finger on the trigger.

question: What if... what if I gave it to... him.
answer: Go ahead... give it to him.

question: R-r-r-really? You r-r-really w-w-want...?
answer: Give it to him. Guess he don't want it, Mister Beauchamp. You was right not to take it, Bob. I would of killed you.

question: I brung this for when we had to kill them fellows. I guess we could use some now.
answer: Not for me. I don't touch it no more.

question: God damn it, Bill, it's rainin'.
answer: I know it's rainin', Give the Kid a drink, why dontcha?

question: You think the Kid really killed five men?
answer: No.

question: What he was talkin' about... how them deputies had the drop on you an' Pete...
answer: Yeah?

question: I remember how there was three of them deputies you shot... not two.
answer: Well, I ain't like that no more, Ned. I ain't no crazy, killin' fool.

question: You still think it'll be easy shootin' them cowboys?
answer: If we don't drown first.

question: "No," he says, "you are wrong Little Bill. That there is no Curly J but a bobbed J." He had worked it over, you see? "Jim," I says, "You are a liar and a horsethief." Now -- when he seen them others wasn't gonna help him none -- he started in to cryin' and sobbin' and sayin'... "Don't kill me, Little Bill, don't kill me, please don't kill me." "Well, Jim," I says, "it makes me sick to see a man struttin' around and packin' two pistols an' a Henry rifle and cryin' like a baby."
answer: Did you... kill him?

question: No,... but I can't abide them kind... an' you will find a lot of them in the saloons... tramps an' drunk teamsters an' crazy miners... sportin' pistols like they was bad men, but not having no sand nor character... not even bad character. I do not like assassins an' men of low character like your friend English Bob... but Bob ain't no coward who will cry to your face an' then...
answer: Uh... Sheriff... Uh...

question: Huh? Oh. Another one, huh? Shit, I guess I'm clean out of receptacles.
answer: Maybe you should... hang the carpenter.

question: What?
answer: Uh... hang the... uh... carpenter. I...

question: ...in hell's takin' The Kid so long? You suppose he... Jesus, Bill you look like shit.
answer: You... you remember Eagle Hendershot?

question: Huh? Uh... yeah.
answer: I seen him.

question: He's dead, Bill.
answer: His head was all busted open so's you could see the inside.

question: Jesus, Bill, you got fever. Take a drink, will you?
answer: Worms was comin' out.

question: Listen, Bill, I'm gonna see what's takin' The Kid so long. Must be he's gettin' an advance offa them sportin' ladies. Say, Bill... If I was to... take a little while myself... I guess you... I guess you... I guess you don't want to come?
answer: Huh?

question: Huh?
answer: I says, "You'll want to give over your pistol."

question: Uh, no. No, I ain't drunk.
answer: Ordinance says you got to turn in your firearms to the County office day or night. I guess you didn't read it with the weather an' all.

question: Well... uh... I... I ain't got no, uh, firearms.
answer: Them friends of yours in the back, they carryin' pistols?

question: I... dunno. I mean, I guess not. No, they ain't carryin' no guns.
answer: You're spillin' your whiskey, mister.

question: Like I said, I...
answer: What's your name?

question: Uh, William... uh... Hendershot.
answer: Well, Mister Hendershot, if I was to call you a no good sonofabitch an' a liar, an' if I was to say you shit in your pants on account of a cowardly soul... well, I guess then, you would show me your pistol right quick an' shoot me dead, ain't that so?

question: I... I guess I might... but like I said, I ain't armed.
answer: I guess you just carry it for snakes an' such.

question: Uh... yeah. Yeah.
answer: There ain't no snakes in here, Mister Hendershot.

question: Well, uh... it ain't loaded. Well, the powder's wet an...
answer: Mister Beauchamp, this here is the sort of trash I was speakin' of. You will find these kind in the saloons of your prosperous communities. But you will not find none of them in Big Whiskey.

question: Oh, Jesus. Oh, Jesus.
answer: Hold him, dammit.

question: Jesus. You done this before?
answer: Plenty of times.

question: His pistol must of jammed.
answer: Move the candle closer, I can't see.

question: He wouldn't of took no beating like that if it hadn't of jammed. He wouldn't just give it over an' not shoot no one. He don't look so good. He didn't even pull his pistol, huh?
answer: He ain't as tough as you, Kid.

question: Well, I guess I woulda at least pulled my pistol an...
answer: Shit, Kid, you pulled your pistol... right outta the lady an' out the back window.

question: Well, we're just waitin' on the weather. If the weather breaks tomorrow we could...
answer: We're gonna need more food... at least three days worth...

question: Three days? We could kill 'em tomorrow.
answer: I don't kill nobody without him.

question: Don't it make you sick, hearin' him like that? Don't you ladies worry none... Me an' Ned, we'll kill those two fuckers. It was a lot of shit what my uncle told me, huh?
answer: Depends what he told you. About Bill, you mean?

question: All of it. About him, an' you an' Uncle Pete... about robbin' the Rock Island Pacific... an' about them Missouri Banks.
answer: We done that stuff.

question: Well I guess Bill Munny wasn't no fearless killer an' bank robber like he said.
answer: Kid, it ain't gonna mean nothin' to you, but the roof I built on my house, it don't have a leak in it... not one. Most folks think a school house is the first sign of civilizin'... but I say it's a good roof. Claudia... ain't here, Bill.

question: Kid, it ain't gonna mean nothin' to you, but the roof I built on my house, it don't have a leak in it... not one. Most folks think a school house is the first sign of civilizin'... but I say it's a good roof. Claudia... ain't here, Bill.
answer: Ned... Is that you, Ned? Ned, I seen... death.

question: Easy, Bill.
answer: I seen the angel of death Ned, an' I seen the river. He's a snake, he got... snake eyes.

question: Who, Bill? Who got snake eyes?
answer: The angel... the angel of death. I'm scared, Ned. Ned, I'm gonna die.

question: Easy, Bill, easy.
answer: I seen her... I seen Claudia too...

question: Well, that's good now, ain't it, Bill? Seein' Claudia an...?
answer: She was all covered with worms. Oh, Ned, I'm scared of dyin'... Ned... don't tell nobody... don't tell the kids... don't tell 'em none of... none of the things I done.

question: He's gonna die, ain't he?
answer: Maybe.

question: Well, suppose he does?
answer: We'll bury him.

question: That ain't what I mean.
answer: You mean, am I gonna help you kill them cowboys?

question: I can't spot 'em myself but you could. That red-haired one, you could spot a half-mile off, I bet.
answer: An' if I spot 'em?

question: I'll ride up close an' shoot 'em!
answer: Just like that?

question: I told you I'm a damn killer. I done it before. I'm more killer than him.
answer: Yeah?

question: I thought... you was an angel.
answer: You ain't dead.

question: Some big guy beat the shit out of me. I guess I must look a lot like you, huh?
answer: You don't look nothin' like me, mister.

question: I didn't mean no offense. I guess you're the one them cowboys cut up. Ned an' The Kid, my partners, are they... ?
answer: They went out scouting when they saw your fever broke.

question: Scouting?
answer: On the Bar T... looking for... them.

question: Oh. How long I been here?
answer: Three days. Are you hungry?

question: Three days? I must be. I thought I was gone. See them birds? Most times I wouldn't even notice them birds much. But I'm noticin' 'em real good 'cause I thought I was dead.
answer: I brought your hat. You... left it down at Greely's.

question: That big guy lookin' for me?
answer: Little Bill? He thinks you went North. Are you really going to kill them?

question: Yeah, I guess. There's still a payment, ain't there?
answer: Them other two, they been takin' advances on the payment.

question: Advances?
answer: Free ones.

question: Free ones?
answer: Alice an' Silky gave them... free ones.

question: Oh. Yeah.
answer: You want... a free one.

question: Me? No. No, I guess not.
answer: I didn't mean... with me. Alice and Silky, they'll give you one... if you want.

question: I... I guess not. I didn't mean I didn't want one 'cause of you bein' cut up. I didn't mean that. It ain't that at all. You're a beautiful woman. What I said before, how I might look like you ... I didn't mean you was ugly like me, hell no... I only meant how we both had scars. You're a beautiful woman an'... if I was to want a free one, I guess I'd want you more than them others. It ain't... See... I can't have no free one on account of my wife...
answer: Your wife?

question: Yeah. See?
answer: I admire that, you being true to your wife. I've seen a lot of... of men... who weren't.

question: Yeah, I guess.
answer: She back in Kansas?

question: Better re-load it.
answer: You missed him? You didn't...?

question: I got him.
answer: He ain't killed.

question: BRING HIM SOME GODDAMN WATER, No.
answer: They takin' water?

question: Yeah.
answer: When we gonna double back?

question: After a ways.
answer: Not me. I'm goin' on down to Kansas.

question: We got to kill this other one first. Shit, Ned, if we're lucky, we could kill him by nightfall... or maybe tomorrow morning. Then we could head back, all three of us, with the money.
answer: You want the Spencer, Bill?

question: Shut up, Kid.
answer: I'll see you, Bill. See you, Kid.

question: HOLD ON, NED. I ain't worth a shit with it. Me an' the Kid, we'll head over to the ranch an' as soon as we find him, we'll shoot him. Then we'll come back an' the three of us pick up the money an' head South together.
answer: Supposin' he don't go to the ranch?

question: I'll bet anything he won't go to town nor he won't ride out on the range. Right off he'll hole up at the ranch.
answer: I ain't waitin', Bill. I'll look in on your youngsters when I get back.

question: I didn't think they'd really do it.
answer: What did you think, they come clear up from Kansas to fuck us?

question: That Kid... he's just a... boy. And that other one, Bill, being true to his wife...
answer: What wife? He don't have no wife.

question: He said...
answer: I told you, he don't have no wife, not aboveground, anyhow. HE HAD IT COMING! HE HAD IT

question: We got one. We got one of them fuckers, we got one... We got one of them fuckers, Sheriff, out by Cow Creek, we...
answer: Alive?

question: Hell, yeah. A bunch of us Bar T boys went out lookin' on account of them killin' one of our own. We come across this fucker on a roan goin' South an'...
answer: He admit it?

question: No... but I guess he will soon enough. Had a Spencer rifle on him an' he was...
answer: Those cowboys messin' him up?

question: Uh... a little, maybe.
answer: You an' Andy get the hell out there. Find out where them other two went.

question: He tell you where them others is?
answer: Nope.

question: He give 'em names?
answer: Didn't give us nothin' but his own name... Ned Roundtree.

question: Sure is fuckin' ripe. I wish we'd get a breeze.
answer: It's gonna get riper yet.

question: You still think he's in there?
answer: Yeah, he's in there.

question: Well, he's holding on to his shit like it was money.
answer: He's in there.

question: Tell me right off if you see him.
answer: Yup.

question: You... you ain't gonna shoot him yourownself?
answer: You can shoot him.

question: Now then, Ned... you an'... uh... Mister Quincy an' uh... What was that young feller's name?
answer: Tate. Elroy Tate.

question: That ain't what you said before, Ned.
answer: Hellif it ain't.

question: Before you said Elroy Quincy out of Medicine Hat an' Henry Tate out of Cheyenne.
answer: Fuck if I did.

question: Come on, Kid. Did... you... get... him?
answer: Yeah.

question: Hold still. Cover me, Kid, while I mount.
answer: I can't see 'em.

question: Just SHOOT!
answer: Where are you, Bill, where are you, I can't see you. Wait for me.

question: Is that what it was like, Bill, in the old days... ridin' out with everybody shootin'... smoke all over an' folks yellin' an' bullets whizzin' by?
answer: Yeah, I guess so.

question: Shit... I thought they was gonna get us. I was even... scared a little... just for a minute. Was you ever scared in them days?
answer: I don't remember, Kid. I was drunk most of the time. Give me a pull on that bottle, will you?

question: I shot that fucker three times. He was takin' a shit. He went for his pistol an' I blazed away... first shot got him in the chest... Say, Bill...
answer: Yeah.

question: That was... the first one.
answer: First one what?

question: First one I ever killed.
answer: Yeah?

question: How I said I shot five men... it wasn't true. That Mexican... the one that come at me with a knife... I busted his leg with a shovel... I didn't shoot him or nothin'.
answer: Well, that fella today, you shot him alright.

question: H-hell yeah. I killed the hell out of him... three shots... he was takin' a sh-sh-shit an'... an'...
answer: Take a drink, Kid.

question: Oh Ch-ch-christ... it don't... it don't seem... real... How he's... DEAD... how he ain't gonna breathe no more... n-n-never. Or the other one neither... On account of... of just... pullin' a trigger.
answer: It's a hell of a thing, ain't it, killin' a man. You take everythin' he's got... an' everythin' he's ever gonna have...

question: Well, I gu-guess they had it... comin'.
answer: We all got it comin', Kid. I was watchin' you... seein' if you was followed.

question: Well, you don't wanna trust me too much. We'll take Ned his share together so you don't figure I run off with it.
answer: Ned's share?

question: Yeah, he went South ahead of us. I guess we'll catch him before...
answer: He's... he's dead.

question: No he ain't. He went South yesterday.
answer: They... they killed him. I... thought you know that. I thought you knew because...

question: Nobody didn't kill Ned, he went South yesterday. He didn't even kill nobody. Why would anybody kill Ned? Who killed him?
answer: Little Bill. The... the Bar T boys caught him and Little Bill...

question: He hanged him? Shot him down?
answer: N-no. He... he beat him up. He was making him... answer questions... and beating him up... and then... Ned just died. Little Bill didn't mean to kill him... he said he was sorry an' all... but he said it was a good example anyhow.

question: Good example! Good example of what I'd like to know? He didn't even kill nobody... he couldn't do it no more.
answer: They got... a sign on him says he was a killer.

question: A sign on him?
answer: In front of Greely's. It says, "This here is what happens to..."

question: They got a sign on him in front of Greely's? The questions Little Bill asked him... what sort of questions was they?
answer: About where you an' him was... an' where you was from... an' what your names was... an'...

question: What'd Ned say?
answer: L-lies... at first. About how you was just passin' through and didn't kill nobody... an' Little Bill kept askin' questions, mixin' him up, catchin' lies... an' then he'd beat on Ned an' Ned would cry and lie some more an' then... then...

question: Then... what?
answer: A cowboy come in sayin' you killed Quick Mike in the shit house at the Bar T...

question: An' Little Bill killed Ned for what I done?
answer: Not on purpose. But he started hurtin' him worse... makin' him tell stuff. First ned wouldn't say nothin'... but Little Bill hurt him so bad he said who you was...

question: Didn't scare Little Bill though, did it?
answer: N-no, sir?

question: Lemmee see that Schofield, Kid.
answer: Wha... what f-for?

question: Lemmee see it.
answer: Sure. Sure, Bill. You... you could keep it, Bill. I ain't... gonna use it no more, I ain't gonna kill nobody. I... I ain't like you, Bill. You... gonna take... the money?

question: You better get on back, Miss.
answer: You could have it. All of it.

question: I thought you wanted to buy spectacles an' fancy clothes an' all.
answer: I'd rather be blind and ragged than dead, I guess.

question: Shit, Kid. I ain't gonna kill you. You're... the only friend I got. This here money, take my share an' Ned's an' leave it with my youngsters. Tell 'em half goes to Sally Two Trees if I ain't back in a week. The rest is yours... you could buy them spectacles.
answer: Are you... Are you gonna... kill Little Bill?

question: I guess you won't mind my keepin' the bottle.
answer: You're gonna kill him, ain't you?

question: Better step clear, boys.
answer: Hold on, mist... Well sir... You are a cowardly sonofabitch because you have just shot down an unarmed man.

question: He should have armed himself if he was gonna decorate his saloon with the body of my friend.
answer: I guess you are Three-Fingered Jack out of Missouri, killer of women and children.

question: I have done that... killed women and children... I have killed most everything that walks or crawls an' now I have come to kill you, Little Bill, for what you done to Ned. Now step aside. boys.
answer: He's got one barrel left, gentlemen. After he has used it, pull your pistols and shoot him down like the cowardly, drunken scoundrel he is. Misfire! Kill the sonofabitch!

question: Every asshole that doesn't want to get shot best clear out the back quick.
answer: I... I... think I'm... shot.

question: You ain't shot.
answer: P-p-p-please, I'm not armed. M-m-my G-god. You killed... Little Bill.

question: You sure you ain't armed?
answer: I never c-c-carry arms. I'm... a writer.

question: A writer? What do you write... letters an' such?
answer: B-b-books. You... you killed five men... singlehanded.

question: Yeah.
answer: Wh-wh-who did you kill first?

question: Huh?
answer: Wh-wh-when confronted by superior numbers, the experienced gunfighter will fire on the best shots first.

question: Yeah?
answer: Little Bill told me that. You killed him first, didn't you?

question: I was lucky in the order. I always been lucky killin' folks.
answer: Who was next? Clyde? Or was it...?

question: I could tell you who was last, mister. Missed again, asshole.
answer: I don't... deserve this... to die this way. I was... building a house.

question: "Deserve" don't mean shit, Little Bill.
answer: I'll see you... in hell, you three-fingered asshole.

question: Ain't you a lady! Place looks good.
answer: Hullo, paw.

question: I guess you lost some hogs to the fever.
answer: Three.

question: Three? That ain't bad considerin'.
answer: That fella come by... Tom.

question: Tom?
answer: The one you rode out after... the one that had the pistol...

question: The Kid, yeah...
answer: Only he wasn't carryin' no pistol this time.

question: He say anythin'... The Kid... ?
answer: Tom? Only how... how if you didn't... didn't come back in a week... how we was to take half the money to Sally an' say you was...

question: Well, I come back, didn't I?
answer: Did you... did you... ?

question: Did I what?
answer: All that money... I mean... did you...?

question: Steal it? Naw, I didn't steal it.
answer: No... I meant...

question: What?
answer: K-k-kill somebody?

question: Who said that?
answer: N-nobody... only you took your shotgun an' that pistol an'...

question: Before I met your maw, God rest her soul, it used to be I was kinda... wicked... drinkin' spirits an' gettin' into scrapes an' all. Only she made me see the error of my ways an'... I ain't like I was no more.
answer: I guess you didn't kill nobody then.
